intro: Alternanthera purpurea, commonly known as the redAlternanthera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its strikingly colorful foliage, often displaying shades of red, pink, and purple. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 3 feet. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are usually borne in clusters at the leaf axils. It thrives in moist, well-drained soil and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in aquatic and terrestrial gardens.
